019package com.plotsquared.core.util;
020
021import com.plotsquared.core.configuration.Settings;
022import com.plotsquared.core.configuration.caption.TranslatableCaption;
023import com.plotsquared.core.permissions.Permission;
024import com.plotsquared.core.permissions.PermissionHolder;
025import com.plotsquared.core.player.PlotPlayer;
026import net.kyori.adventure.text.Component;
027import net.kyori.adventure.text.minimessage.tag.Tag;
028import net.kyori.adventure.text.minimessage.tag.resolver.TagResolver;
029import org.checkerframework.checker.nullness.qual.NonNull;
030
031/**
032 * The Permissions class handles checking user permissions.<br>
033 * - This will respect * nodes and plots.admin and can be used to check permission ranges (e.g. plots.plot.5)<br>
034 * - Checking the PlotPlayer class directly will not take the above into account<br>
035 *
036 * @deprecated all logic that may once have been in the class lives elsewhere. We also want to do away with statically-accessed
037 *         classes
038 */
039@Deprecated(forRemoval = true, since = "6.9.3")
040public class Permissions {
041
042    /**
043     * @deprecated all logic that may once have been in the class lives elsewhere. We also want to do away with statically-accessed
044     *         classes. Use {@link PlotPlayer#hasPermission(String, boolean)}
045     */
046    @Deprecated(forRemoval = true, since = "6.9.3")
047    public static boolean hasPermission(PlotPlayer<?> player, Permission permission, boolean notify) {
048        return hasPermission(player, permission.toString(), notify);
049    }
050
051    /**
052     * Check if the owner of the profile has a given (global) permission
053     *
054     * @param caller     permission holder
055     * @param permission Permission
056     * @return {@code true} if the owner has the given permission, else {@code false}
057     * @deprecated all logic that may once have been in the class lives elsewhere. We also want to do away with statically-accessed
058     *         classes. Use {@link PermissionHolder#hasPermission(Permission)}
059     */
060    @Deprecated(forRemoval = true, since = "6.9.3")
061    public static boolean hasPermission(final @NonNull PermissionHolder caller, final @NonNull Permission permission) {
062        return caller.hasPermission(permission.toString());
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * Check if the owner of the profile has a given (global) permission. There is no guarantee that per-world permissions will
067     * be checked because unmaintained crap plugins like PEX exist.
068     *
069     * @param caller     permission holder
070     * @param permission Permission
071     * @return {@code true} if the owner has the given permission, else {@code false}
072     * @deprecated all logic that may once have been in the class lives elsewhere. We also want to do away with statically-accessed
073     *         classes. Use {@link PermissionHolder#hasPermission(String)}
074     */
075    @Deprecated(forRemoval = true, since = "6.9.3")
076    public static boolean hasPermission(final @NonNull PermissionHolder caller, final @NonNull String permission) {
077        return caller.hasPermission(permission);
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Check if the owner of the profile has a given (global) keyed permission. Checks both {@code permission.key}
082     * and {@code permission.*}
083     *
084     * @param caller     permission holder
085     * @param permission Permission
086     * @param key        Permission "key"
087     * @return {@code true} if the owner has the given permission, else {@code false}
088     * @since 6.0.10
089     * @deprecated all logic that may once have been in the class lives elsewhere. We also want to do away with statically-accessed
090     *         classes. Use {@link PermissionHolder#hasKeyedPermission(String, String)}
091     */
092    @Deprecated(forRemoval = true, since = "6.9.3")
093    public static boolean hasKeyedPermission(
094            final @NonNull PermissionHolder caller, final @NonNull String permission,
095            final @NonNull String key
096    ) {
097        return caller.hasKeyedPermission(permission, key);
098    }
099
100    /**
101     * Checks if a PlotPlayer has a permission, and optionally send the no permission message if applicable.
102     *
103     * @param player     permission holder
104     * @param permission permission
105     * @param notify     if to notify the permission holder
106     * @return if permission is had
107     * @deprecated all logic that may once have been in the class lives elsewhere. We also want to do away with statically-accessed
108     *         classes. Use {@link PlotPlayer#hasPermission(String, boolean)}
109     */
110    @Deprecated(forRemoval = true, since = "6.9.3")
111    public static boolean hasPermission(PlotPlayer<?> player, String permission, boolean notify) {
112        if (!hasPermission(player, permission)) {
113            if (notify) {
114                player.sendMessage(
115                        TranslatableCaption.of("permission.no_permission_event"),
116                        TagResolver.resolver("node", Tag.inserting(Component.text(permission)))
117                );
118            }
119            return false;
120        }
121        return true;
122    }
123
124    /**
125     * @deprecated all logic that may once have been in the class lives elsewhere. We also want to do away with statically-accessed
126     *         classes. Use {@link PlotPlayer#hasPermissionRange(Permission, int)}
127     */
128    @Deprecated(forRemoval = true, since = "6.9.3")
129    public static int hasPermissionRange(PlotPlayer<?> player, Permission Permission, int range) {
130        return hasPermissionRange(player, Permission.toString(), range);
131    }
132
133    /**
134     * Check the highest permission a PlotPlayer has within a specified range.<br>
135     * - Excessively high values will lag<br>
136     * - The default range that is checked is {@link Settings.Limit#MAX_PLOTS}<br>
137     *
138     * @param player Player to check for
139     * @param stub   The permission stub to check e.g. for `plots.plot.#` the stub is `plots.plot`
140     * @param range  The range to check
141     * @return The highest permission they have within that range
142     * @deprecated all logic that may once have been in the class lives elsewhere. We also want to do away with statically-accessed
143     *         classes. Use {@link PlotPlayer#hasPermissionRange(String, int)}
144     */
145    @Deprecated(forRemoval = true, since = "6.9.3")
146    public static int hasPermissionRange(PlotPlayer<?> player, String stub, int range) {
147        return player.hasPermissionRange(stub, range);
148    }
149
150}
